results.title: Report on cancer
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: The drama and suspense of impending victory as medical practitioners probe into the mysteries of one of mankind’s most baffling diseases: cancer. The audience is taken to the forefront of the struggle to witness experiments in the field of bio-physics, and the radiation techniques developed for observing cellular activity and malignant growth. A new theory - that cancer may have its beginning with a virus - is discussed by a panel of doctors doing fundamental research at the Ontario Cancer Institute. Patients in this film are played by the Staff of the Princess Margaret Hospital in Toronto.

results.title: Report on British hovercraft
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions, British Petroleum and Gerard Bryant
results.brief_description: A report on British hovercraft and the capabilities and achievements of various types. Principal operational and technical features of these craft are explained, and the survey shows the operation of passenger services with the Westland SRN 2, and the development of the British-Norman CC2 for commercial operation.

results.title: Report on Borobudur
results.brief_description: The Borobudur Temple in Indonesia was built twelve centuries ago. This most important monument of Buddhism and unique work of art is threatened with imminent destruction. International help is needed to save it. This report by Yemi Lijadu and Francine Vande Wiele was based on a film directed by Theo Van Haren Noman.

results.title: Report on acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Leo Seltzer Associates and Leo Seltzer
results.brief_description: The ancient practice of acupuncture, used for over fifty centuries in the treatment of variety of human ailments, is noted by the narration to be the standard form of medicine for over half the world’s population. Based on the concept that human ills, be they migraine headache, insomnia, backache, deafness and other afflictions, may be cured or eased by the artificial manipulation of certain energy flows in the body. The film covers diagnostic methods, the insertion of needles, their manipulation to increase or decrease the energy flow, the use of herbs used with this treatment. Studies are being conducted in which acupuncture and Western medicine are being integrated for even greater results in the treatment.

results.title: Report from the Aleutians
results.creator_credit: United States. Army. Signal Corps and John Huston
results.brief_description: A documentary of life on a lonely airbase on Adak Island in the Aleutians during World War II. For the men of the base, the enemy was the snow, mud, grey skies and boredom punctuated by an occasional bombing raid. John Huston spent six months on the Island and was nearly killed while filming the climactic raid.

results.title: Report from Queensland. No. 2. The Herds move in
results.brief_description: Looks at the beef export industry in Queensland. Shows how cattle are taken annually from Queensland to New South Wales for fattening and takes note of how more hardy strains of cattle are bing bred.

results.title: Report for Colombo
results.brief_description: A report on the Colombo Plan, showing the services and facilities it is offering to the countries of south-east Asia. Shows visits of Indian, Pakistani and Ceylonese students and scientists to Australia; Asian students studying in Australian schools, technical colleges and universities; shipment of food, materials and equipment to south-east Asia.

results.title: Report
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Keith Gow and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
Indication of the dangers faced by employees jumping to incorrect conclusions based on second-hand and unreliable information from the Union delegate about management’s intentions.

results.title: Repo man
results.creator_credit: Michael Nesmith Productions, Edge City Productions, Jonathan Wacks, Peter McCarthy and Alex Cox
results.brief_description: A groundbreaking movie that introduced a punk sensibility to the film noir genre. Otto (Emilio Estevez) is a bored young man, just fired from his job in a supermarket, who meets up with a smooth-talking loner (Harry Dean Stanton) who recruits him as a “repo man”: a repossesor of cars because of default of payment. The strange plot involves aliens, Government spies and assorted punks and gangsters all searching for a 1964 Chevy Malibu which may hold the secret of life and death. The plot, however, doesn’t really matter. What does is the assured surreal landscape that Alex Cox discovers in the underbelly of suburban Los Angeles, and his irreverent experiments with genre. The LA of Repo Man is a disintegrating city, violent and alienated, but the film manages to undiscover a weird and sometimes eloquent beauty in the decay. The soundtrack, featuring US independant punk music from bands like Circle Jerks, Suicidal Tendencies, Black Flag and Iggy Pop is outstanding.

results.title: Replanting the tree of life
results.brief_description: This award-winning program takes a stimulating look at trees from a variety of viewpoints. It not only shows the importance of trees to the environment, showing how the trees purify the air and process water, but also to culture, religion, industry, the economy and the future. Taking a global perspective, the program discusses the worldwide use of trees and the threat of deforestation. Suitable for Senior Primary and Junior Secondary students.
